intro: Ptychogyne bimaculata, commonly known as the two-spotted ptychogyne, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
